lines.text: I can't understand why you have this terrible fear of animals in you. What is it?
When I was a little baby I was scared by my piggy bank.
That's nonsense.
[walks away]

[Grabs Buzz]
You wanna hear something worse?
What?
I was 15 years old before I ate my first animal cracker.
That's the kind of girl I dream about. But you should see the ones I get.

[sees Harry with a glass of water]
Where're you going with the water?
Oh my tent's on fire!

[while in Africa]
So if I draw the map I can go home?
What do you want to go home for?
I forgot something.
What did you forget?
I forgot to stay there.
[first lines]
Stay right where you are. Don't move, stay there now. Steady. Now sit up. Sit up. Sit up you. Up you fool. Up. Sit up I said. Sit up. Up.

[to Diana]
Allow me to introduce Stanley Livington, one of the world's greatest wild game hunters.
You mean, you intend to take a trip to Africa?
Very definitely. I'm planning a safari.
Listen boss, I'm not going along. You've got no right to put me in a thing like that. You're always putting me right in the middle
Don't tell me that. Don't you give me that. No arguments.
Say Mr. Buck, is there really such an animal as the Orangutang Gargantua?
Of course there is.
There is?
It went right around this district now.

[to Stanley]
Stanley's a coward, Stanley's a coward. Afraid of a little teeny weeny alligator like that.

[to Stanley]
I'm going to make a hero out of you whether you like it or not.

[to Stanley]
I'm going into the cage and you behave yourself. I can't understand why he gets so scared.
I'm not afraid of nothing . Not even you. I'm a pretty brave kid. I don't care about kittens. I don't care how big the kittens are.
I thought that you were... Buzz, I'm paralysed.

[to Diana]
The chief has a sweet tooth for the little fat man.
Have you seen a short fat man and a tall thin man running through the jungle?
No. I don't want to either.
Now I'll never catch up to them!
Now that I'm alone, what's going to happen to me now?

[to Grappler]
I'll hit you harder than Louis ever did.
[last lines]
Mr Livington, what about that raise I've been asking for?
I'll talk to my partner if he's in.
Thank you, Sir.
He's in.
Have you seen Stanley?

[wearing thick glasses]
No I haven't.
Well if you do, tell him to hide out until he sees me.
Okay I'll tell him, but I haven't seen Africa yet.
[wistfully]
How is it?
